title: What is the relationship between innocence and purity in spiritual practice?
first_phrase: In the previous paragraphs, the author discusses the purity and innocence of the human spirit and how it becomes corrupted as it progresses through life. The author also touches on the symbolism of the child in various religions and describes the potency of the word when pronounced with a pure spirit. In the last 200 tokens, the author delves deeper into the power of words and their connection to spiritual purification. They explain that words are acts of creation that can transform anything and that this transformation can be achieved through initiation into magic or religious asceticism. The author also emphasizes the importance of purifying oneself of the pollution of social life to achieve spiritual purity.
content: Facilmente si intenderà' ora che più' prossimo o lontana e' Io spirito umano dalla sua purità' originale e più' efficace o meno e' l'azione, più' rapido o meno il suo effetto nella realta' sensoria. La parola per se', dovunque e comunque pronunziata e' un atto di creazione - ed e' la base di tutta la prima magia. Ciò' che tu chiami carne e' tale se hai la virtù' spirituale di cangiare ogni cosa in carne. Questa virtù' spirituale che da vita alle idee espresse e volute, si ottiene con una paziente purificazione di se stesso di ciò' che la vita sociale ci ha addizionato alla nostra primitiva natura. Questa purificazione o lavoro della immondizia umana sulla spirito umanizzato si ottiene per iniziazione in magia operante e per ascetismo in natura religiosa.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the purification of oneself from the impurities of society is crucial to obtain the spiritual virtue needed to bring ideas to life. This can be achieved through initiation into operative magick and asceticism in religious nature. The initiation into the sacred mysteries and traditional purifying rites of the Order should be followed carefully, leading to the ultimate goal of guiding others with truth and wisdom towards the recovery of lost powers.
